My wife and I, along with our two toddler daughters traversed here via SUV. Once we arrived, we discovered that you have to get a special permit at some other location just to park near an old cabin next to the 2nd gate. There is NO Parking anywhere. There are signs that indicates that it is permit parking only and that it’s regularly patrolled in big red letters and threaten to tow your vehicle. Very small place, with a plethora of picky directions at the first entrance gate stating to close the the gate after entry and exiting. Just a total WASTE OF TIME! 

We just turned around and left. Don’t waste your precious time with the hassle of this small uneventful little wanna be park!

We've been going to this park for years (it's a short walk from my in-laws).  This is great park for a walk, job or maybe fishing.  There are areas for picnics but the grills are a bit nasty and there is just one porta potty so I wouldn't recommend any big events.

name: Thurgood Marshall Memorial
reviews: We were in Annapolis over thanksgiving 2019 and the statute has moved ti the court of appeals which you will need to drive too! Street work through the first of the year.
As a lawyer and professor of law, spending time at the Thurgood Marshall Memorial is important. I like the fact that our elected officials must walk by the statute on their way to the a State House.
Right off the state house. Interesting reading on Thurgood Marshall. Well kept area; Enjoyed the surrounding statues with his memorial also.

This is located in front of the Maryland State House. Its a bit out of the way from most foot traffic unless you are visiting the State House. The memorial includes additional statues of children who Thurgood is supposed to be speaking at or teaching. This is a very good memorial and should not be missed.

This is larger than life and in an area near the government buildings.  Since,we were their on a weekend we had this almost all to ourself.  There are other sculptures that you cannot see in this picture.  I sat down next to two children sculptures at a bench for a photo opt.

name: Alumni Hall
reviews: Patriot League is very competitive. Season tickets are very reasonable ($5) and can provide first-rate seats. Army/Navy games are always a sell out. Parking is limited at Academy. You also need  a pass to drive into yard. Navy season ticket holders can get pass. Food limited to hot dogs and pizza.

What a great venue. Not inly is the history of the place cool but watching a sporting event here is fun.  Top notch sports and great site lines.  Navy always does a great job of making it fun for fans and the kids.

Alumni Hall is an intimate basketball arena that's great tho watch a game in. My wife and I traveled here to watch Marquette and Vanderbilt in the Veteran's Classic. We were in the upper deck, but it was no problem as Alumni Hall has great seats up to the rafters. Plentiful concession stands and options, tons of exhibits and history, Alumni Hall has it all. Superb arena.

Walked in before a Patriot League game later in the afternoon.  Saw the Navy team practicing.  Super sight lines all around.  Interesting history all around.  Wonderful views of the court from each side and above.  I will most definitely come back for a game.  Small, intimate venue offering a fun atmosphere.  Highly recommend!
Went for closing ceremonies for Summer Seminar and was very impressed with the facility! Clean, modern and huge!
Did a great job hosting Parents Weekends event.  Key to hosting a successful event is keeping up with the mobs.  Bathrooms stayed clean, trash did not overflow, A/C worked.  Thanks

What a great venue. Not inly is the history of the place cool but watching a sporting event here is fun.  Top notch sports and great site lines.  Navy always does a great job of making it fun for fans and the kids.

This is the public sports facility for the Naval Academy.  Like many things at the Academy, no tax dollars were used in it's design or construction.  All funding came from past graduates of that institution, which is even more amazing when one considers that, until about 10 years ago, the place only graduated about 900 people a year!

name: The Colonial Players
reviews: Wonderful local theater in Annapolis.  Non-profit, mostly volunteer, who produce plays that you don't see in the larger theaters.  Intimate in-the-round seating.  Acting and direction has always been high quality.  Don't always love the plays, but don't want to miss any - some are real gems.

We Attended an presentation of Shakespeare’s Merry Wives of Windsor in this “theater in the round” where you’re only, at most, 3 rows from the action on stage.

The 3 rows of audience seating meant everyone had an exceptional view of the action. And the seats were staggered so it was easy to see even if there was someone tall in front. Although called “theater in the round” or was actually rectangular as you can tell by the very good seating diagram on their web site.

This interpretation was interesting - Shakespearean speech from the mouths of people in modern dress. It was a bit disconcerting at first, but was less distracting after about 10-15 minutes. The acting was very good, the use of minimal props made the play viewable from all directions and the cast made excellent use of floor space, to include the aisle in the the audience. It was a jolly good show!!

Nice lobby, friendly front of house, a small very reasonably priced snack bar. Street parking if you can find, else several,public (paid or free depending on location and day/time of week) within 5-15 minutes walk. Lots of walkable restaurants for drinks or a pre/post bite.
We really enjoyed Saturday's performance of "The Merry Wives of Windsor"  What a great community theater with intimate seating.
We recently enjoyed the play Lucky Stiff.  It was well done and very funny with twists and turns throughout the play.
Colonial Players is a wonderful theater. Great productions and I love the design of the theater. I recommend it.

name: Annapolis Shakespeare Company - The Classical Theatre of Maryland
reviews: We have never been disappointed by the productions at this theatre.  Our daughter, her husband and their two teenage children accompanied us to a production of Christmas Carol.  They thoroughly enjoyed the production which was in the small theatre.  We sat on the front row, only a few feet away from the actors.  It was a meticulous performance with use of audio visual effects to help set the scenes.  Highly recommended for a night of good entertainment.  Typical prices are $50 each.

My husband and I went to the showing of Oliver last night and what an enjoyable show!  Broadway quality on a much more intimate scale.  It's a shame they don't have a larger advertising campaign, because I think there are a lot of folks in the area that have no idea this theater is here.  I haven't been to any other shows there, but I highly recommend this one.

We watched a pre-Christmas production of A Christmas Carol.  The auditorium has a small stage with the seating close in on 3 of the 4 sides.  It was very personal for the audience to be so close to the actors.  The production was very good. It kept my two young sons captivated throughout.  

The break included a lovely hot chocolate from the bar. 

The theatre is easy to get to, being just off the main highway and had ample free parking.  

Overall a great start to the Christmas holiday season.

My husband and I went here on our daughter’s recommendation, we were not disappointed.  We went to the indoor West St. location (summertime offers outdoor locations elsewhere downtown).  They have a cocktail lounge setting while you wait for the show, you can take your drink in with you.  When it’s showtime, you are escorted into the theater.  The venue is small so no bad seats!  
    The actors, costumes, set were all top notch!  Very impressed!  Check out the Period Cabaret shows as well as holiday productions.

Always enjoyable. Annapolis Shakespeare Company is a beautiful little blackbox venue, is the only contemporary (and comfortable) performance theater in town, and they have a full bar with piano and cabaret seating that is open before productions. They also offer Cabaret music in addition to their drama productions. During warm weather they will often host productions outside on historic sites.  They are a paid professional theater. If you are in town, try to get a ticket to whatever is showing.

name: Port Annapolis Marina
reviews: Recommend seafood delicacies. Crab is cooked to perfection. Naval Academy annual air show is a site to see.

This is a great place for boat lovers. I love to watch the boats and all the activities going on in the marina. Power boats and beautiful sailboats everywhere. One of the boating capitols of the east coast.

What a serene place. We lucked out. The day was beautiful, the water was calm, and all was peaceful. 

Wonderful visit.

I worked on two different boats over the course of a winter here. The staff was always friendly and courteous, not to mention professional. As the weather warmed up it was nice to use their picnic area for lunch breaks. From all the other people that we saw working there and storing their boats, this seemed to be the general consensus. For winter haul out work I would recommend these guys or Jabins.

This is a wonderful marina for a quick weekend getaway.  The pool is very nice and offers several umbrella tables, along with 2 canvas cabanas for shade.  There is a cafe onsite which offers breakfast, lunch and dinner, along with drinks and snacks.  This is very convenient if you didn't bring food on the boat and/or don't want to go into town.  They advertise a shuttle service, but that was not available either time we went.  It is too far to walk and biking along the route into town is dangerous since the sidewalks are very narrow.  If the shuttle was available, I would have rated this with 5 stars.  Boaters would really appreciate this convenience!!!    NOTE: The water taxi does run here but is very expensive.  $15 per trip if only 2 people (each way), or $5,50 per person if more then 3 people ride.
